overview:
At the age of 25, Ben Cathers has made his mark on the business world. When he was 12 years old, Ben started a web marketing and advertising firm geared towards teenagers. The firm ultimately grew into an enterprise with 10 employees and a marketing network of over 300 million advertisements a month. In the year 2000, when Ben was only 15 years old, the Silicon Alley Reporter named the firm as one of the â€œTop 12 companies in Silicon Alley to look out forâ€.

At the age of 17, Ben left the firm to start a syndicated radio show called Teen America. Teen America went live during January 2002. Before its first episode, Teen America was picked up by a national syndicator and received clearance on numerous CBS radio and 50,000 watt stations. The radio show and company were profitable upon inception.

At the age of 19, Ben published his first book â€œConversations with Teen Entrepreneursâ€. The book, published by iUniverse Inc, is available on Amazon.com, BarnesandNoble.com and a slew of other bookstores.

At 19 Ben became Co-founder & COO of Search Rate Technologies LLC. Search Rate Technologies was an enterprise search company focused on improving search for internal users of large corporate databases. Ben also became the executive producer and co-founder of Klick-TV. Klick-TV was a video on demand TV network focusing on college students and young adults. Launched in the fall of 2004, Klick-TV was available in over a million homes.

Today Ben is based in NYC where he runs the social media group of Lightspeed Financial and is on the advisory boards of Zepfrog Corp, BranchR.com and Galaxy Smith Records. Ben also tours the country speaking on topics of entrepreneurship, social media and gen-y issues.

Ben is a graduate of the Boston University School of Management. During his sophomore year, Ben helped teach the year long freshman course â€œManagement as a Systemâ€. In 2007, Ben received the first annual Peter R Russo Award in Entrepreneurship from Boston Universityâ€™s Institute for Technology Entrepreneurship and Commercialization.

Born and raised on Long Island, New York, Ben resides in the Upper East Side of Manhattan. In his free time, Ben enjoys playing on his Central Park Softball Team, The Weekend Swingers, playing basketball in the NY Urban Professionals Basketball League, throwing people in Judo and actively exploring and walking NYC.

Today he is an amazing advisor to several startups in his fields of expertise. Ambitious and passionate about business, he helps others achieve success and follow their dreams.
